definitions.definition: The ability to speak ; the faculty of uttering words or articulate sounds and vocalizations to communicate .
examples: He had a bad speech impediment.
After the accident she lost her speech .

definitions.definition: The act of speaking, a certain style of it.
examples: It was hard to hear his speech over the noise.
Her speech was soft and lilting.

definitions.definition: A formal session of speaking , especially a long oral message given publicly by one person.
examples: The candidate made some ambitious promises in his campaign speech .

definitions.definition: A dialect , vernacular , or ( dated ) a language .
Language used orally , rather than in writing.
examples: This word is mostly used in speech .

definitions.definition: An utterance that is quoted ; see direct speech , reported speech

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The ability to speak ; the faculty of uttering words or articulate sounds and vocalizations to communicate .
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) The act of speaking, a certain style of it.
( countable ) A formal session of speaking , especially a long oral message given publicly by one person.
( countable ) A dialect , vernacular , or ( dated ) a language .
( uncountable ) Language used orally , rather than in writing.
( grammar ) An utterance that is quoted ; see direct speech , reported speech
( uncountable ) Public talk , news , gossip , rumour .
